variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: gperf
dependencies.description:
GNU gperf is a perfect hash function generator. For a given list of
strings, it produces a hash function and hash table, in form of C or C++
code, for looking up a value depending on the input string. The hash
function is perfect, which means that the hash table has no collisions,
and the hash table lookup needs a single string comparison only.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependent_to.name: slirp4netns
dependent_to.description: User-mode networking for unprivileged network namespaces

dependent_to.name: nix
dependent_to.description: Nix, the purely functional package manager

dependent_to.name: podman
dependent_to.description:
An optionally rootless and daemonless container engine: alias
docker=podman

dependent_to.name: apptainer
dependent_to.description:
Apptainer is an open source container platform designed to be simple,
fast, and secure. Many container platforms are available, but Apptainer
is designed for ease-of-use on shared systems and in high performance
computing (HPC) environments. Needs post-install chmod/chown steps to
enable full functionality. See package definition or `spack-build-
out.txt` build log for details, e.g.: tail -15 $(spack location -i
apptainer)/.spack/spack-build-out.txt

dependent_to.name: runc
dependent_to.description:
CLI tool for spawning containers on Linux according to the OCI
specification

dependent_to.name: singularityce
dependent_to.description:
Singularity is a container technology focused on building portable
encapsulated environments to support "Mobility of Compute" For older
versions of Singularity (pre 3.0) you should use singularity-legacy,
which has a different install base (Autotools). Needs post-install
chmod/chown steps to enable full functionality. See package definition
or `spack-build-out.txt` build log for details, e.g. tail -15 $(spack
location -i singularityce)/.spack/spack-build-out.txt

dependent_to.name: singularity
dependent_to.description:
Singularity is a container technology focused on building portable
encapsulated environments to support "Mobility of Compute" For older
versions of Singularity (pre 3.0) you should use singularity-legacy,
which has a different install base (Autotools). Needs post-install
chmod/chown steps to enable full functionality. See package definition
or `spack-build-out.txt` build log for details, e.g. tail -15 $(spack
location -i singularity)/.spack/spack-build-out.txt
